definitions: popular movement or activity that attracts support because many others have joined
examples: Everyone jumped on the green energy bandwagon this year
The marketing team climbed on the social media bandwagon

definitions: range of frequencies used for transmitting electronic signals and data
available mental or emotional capacity to handle tasks or information
examples: The video call requires more bandwidth than our connection provides
We upgraded our internet bandwidth to support remote work
She doesn't have the bandwidth to take on another project
My emotional bandwidth is limited during stressful periods

definitions: cause of persistent trouble, distress, or destruction to something
examples: Mosquitoes are the bane of summer camping trips
Traffic congestion has become the bane of urban life

definitions: small firework that makes a loud explosive sound
thick sausage typically served with mashed potatoes
old car in poor condition that makes noise
exceptionally popular or successful song or musical track
examples: Children threw bangers during the holiday celebrations
The loud bangers frightened the neighborhood dogs
He ordered bangers and mash at the British pub
The breakfast included eggs, beans, and two bangers
His old banger barely made it up the hill
She drives a rusty banger from the 1990s
That new song is an absolute banger
The DJ played nothing but bangers all night

definitions: continuous loud sounds made by repeated hitting or striking
examples: The banging from the construction site lasted all day
We heard banging on the door at midnight

definitions: official order forcing someone to leave a place permanently as punishment
examples: The king ordered the traitor's banishment from the kingdom
His banishment from the community lasted twenty years

definitions: handrail with its supporting posts along the side of a staircase
examples: Children love sliding down the wooden banister
She gripped the banister tightly while descending

definitions: round-bodied stringed instrument with a long neck played by plucking
examples: He played folk songs on his five-string banjo
The bluegrass band featured banjo and fiddle music

definitions: piece of paper money issued by a bank or government
examples: She counted the banknotes carefully before paying
The new banknote features enhanced security features

definitions: person legally declared unable to pay their debts
examples: The bankrupt lost his house and car
Many bankrupts struggle to rebuild their credit

definitions: long strip of cloth or paper with words or images for display
rectangular advertisement displayed on a website
examples: The protest banner stretched across the entire street
Welcome banners decorated the conference hall
The banner ad appeared at the top of the webpage
She clicked on the banner to learn more

definitions: official act of forbidding something by law or authority
examples: The banning of plastic bags reduced environmental waste
Parents protested the banning of certain books

definitions: handrail with its supporting posts along the side of a staircase
examples: The old bannister needed repainting and repair
She polished the oak bannister until it gleamed

definitions: elaborate formal meal for many people celebrating a special occasion
examples: The wedding banquet featured seven courses
They attended the annual awards banquet downtown

definitions: activity of attending or organizing elaborate formal meals
examples: The banqueting hall hosted events every weekend
Medieval banqueting involved entertainment between courses

definitions: female spirit in Irish folklore whose wailing warns of death
examples: Legend says the banshee's cry foretells a death
She screamed like a banshee when she saw the spider

definitions: small breed of domestic chicken with feathered legs
examples: The bantam rooster strutted around the farmyard proudly
Bantams make excellent pets due to their size

definitions: weight division in boxing for fighters typically under 118 pounds
examples: The bantamweight champion defended his title successfully
She competed in the bantamweight division for years

definitions: playful and friendly exchange of teasing remarks
examples: Their witty banter entertained everyone at dinner
The banter between teammates showed their close friendship

definitions: Christian religious ceremony using water to admit someone to the church
person's first experience of something difficult or challenging
examples: The baby's baptism took place on Sunday morning
Family gathered to witness the baptism ceremony
His first day was a baptism of fire
The crisis served as her baptism into leadership

definitions: building or area in a church used for baptism ceremonies
examples: The ancient baptistery featured beautiful mosaic artwork
They entered through the baptistery's ornate bronze doors

definitions: building or area in a church used for baptism ceremonies
examples: The baptistry contained a large marble font
Medieval baptistries were often separate from churches

definitions: sharp projection near the end of an arrow or fishhook
deliberately hurtful or critical remark
examples: The fishhook's barb prevented the fish from escaping
Wire fences with barbs lined the property
Her barb about his appearance stung deeply
He ignored the barbs from his critics

definitions: person considered primitive, uncivilized, or brutally cruel
examples: The Romans called northern tribes barbarians
He ate like a barbarian at the formal dinner

definitions: extremely cruel and brutal behavior lacking civilized restraint
examples: The documentary exposed the barbarism of war
Such barbarism has no place in modern society

definitions: outdoor meal or party where food is cooked over fire
metal frame or grill for cooking food outdoors over fire
examples: We're hosting a barbecue for the neighborhood Saturday
The summer barbecue featured grilled corn and burgers
He bought a new barbecue for the backyard
Clean the barbecue grates before cooking

definitions: long metal bar with removable weights at each end for exercise
examples: She loaded the barbell with fifty pounds
The gym provided barbells in various weights

definitions: outdoor meal or party where food is cooked over fire
metal frame or grill for cooking food outdoors over fire
examples: The company barbeque brought everyone together
They enjoyed ribs at the Texas barbeque
The barbeque needs new propane before cooking
We assembled the barbeque on the patio

definitions: person whose job is cutting men's hair and shaving beards
examples: The barber gave him a classic short haircut
She visits her barber every three weeks

definitions: shop where barbers cut hair and provide grooming services
examples: The vintage barbershop featured red leather chairs
Men gathered at the barbershop to discuss news

definitions: poet and storyteller who composed and recited verses about heroes
examples: The medieval bard entertained the royal court
Shakespeare is often called the Bard of Avon

definitions: something bought for less than its usual price
agreement between parties settling what each will give or receive
examples: The coat was a real bargain at half price
She found bargains at the clearance sale
They struck a bargain after hours of negotiation
The bargain satisfied both parties involved

definitions: process of discussing terms to reach an agreement
examples: Collective bargaining improved workers' conditions significantly
The bargaining continued late into the night

definitions: long flat-bottomed boat for carrying freight on canals and rivers
examples: The barge transported coal down the river
Canal barges moved slowly through the locks

definitions: act of uncovering or revealing something previously hidden
examples: The baring of secrets damaged their friendship
His baring of emotions surprised everyone present

definitions: male singing voice between tenor and bass
brass instrument pitched between trumpet and tuba
examples: The baritone sang the leading role beautifully
His rich baritone voice filled the concert hall
She played baritone in the marching band
The baritone section practiced their parts separately

definitions: soft silvery-white metallic chemical element used in medical imaging
examples: The patient drank barium before the X-ray
Barium compounds create green colors in fireworks

definitions: tough protective outer layer covering tree trunks and branches
sharp explosive sound made by dogs
examples: The bark peeled off the birch tree naturally
Cork comes from the bark of oak trees
The dog's bark warned of approaching strangers
Her bark was worse than her bite

definitions: person who calls out to attract customers to entertainment
dog that barks frequently or loudly
examples: The carnival barker promoted the amazing attractions
Street barkers tried to lure tourists inside
Their barker kept the neighbors awake nightly
The little barker scared away the mailman

definitions: cereal grain used for making beer, animal feed, and food
examples: Farmers harvested barley for the local brewery
Barley soup warmed them on cold winter days

definitions: woman who serves drinks in a bar or pub
examples: The friendly barmaid knew every regular's favorite drink
She worked as a barmaid during college

definitions: man who serves drinks in a bar or pub
examples: The barman mixed cocktails with impressive skill
He asked the barman for a recommendation

definitions: small marine crustacean that attaches permanently to rocks and ship hulls
examples: Barnacles covered the bottom of the old boat
Removing barnacles requires scraping and special tools

definitions: area around a barn where farm animals are kept
examples: Chickens pecked for food in the barnyard
The barnyard smelled of hay and animals

definitions: instrument that measures atmospheric pressure to forecast weather
something that indicates changes in a situation or condition
examples: The barometer showed falling pressure before the storm
Sailors relied on barometers for weather prediction
Stock prices serve as a barometer of economic health
Public opinion polls are political barometers

definitions: member of the lowest rank of British nobility
wealthy powerful person in business or industry
examples: The baron inherited his title and estate
Medieval barons controlled vast territories
The oil baron influenced government energy policy
Media barons shaped public opinion significantly

definitions: holder of a hereditary title ranking below baron
examples: The baronet attended the royal garden party
His grandfather was made a baronet for public service

definitions: domain of a baron or the rank of baron
examples: The ancient barony included three villages
He inherited the barony from his father

definitions: highly ornate and detailed European style of art and architecture from 1600-1750
examples: The baroque church featured elaborate golden decorations
Baroque music emphasized emotion and ornamentation
